page.title: 07Trees In Ogmore and Wyndham.
page.content: The Forestry Commission has planted thousands of conifers which include Japanese Larch, Conican Pine, Lodge Pole, Pine, Norway Spruce, Sitka Spruce and Scotch Pine. Tree felling has been going on in the Ogmore Forest for a number of years. In certain parts of the valley, trees such as Siver Bush, Rowan, Apple Blossom have been planted to make the area look more attractive. Last year children from the school planted Rowan and Silver Bush Trees just outside the school as part of the National Tree Planting Week. The laregest broadleaved woodland is the Aber woods which consists mainly of oak trees. There is a Tree Preservation Order covering a group of mixed hardwoods in the gounds of Gorwyl House, Ogmore Vale.
